DataElement.preferredName: Patient Treated Stable Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm in the Brain Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator to determine clinical trial participation for questions related to treated and stable metastatic brain cancer as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Treating Stable Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm in the Brain Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Providing treatment for._Subject to little fluctuation; showing little if any change._A malignant neoplasm that has spread to the brain from another anatomic site or system. The majority are carcinomas (usually lung or breast carcinomas)._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Treating Stable Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm in the Brain Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Providing treatment for.:Subject to little fluctuation; showing little if any change.:A malignant neoplasm that has spread to the brain from another anatomic site or system. The majority are carcinomas (usually lung or breast carcinomas).:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Subject to little fluctuation; showing little if any change.

Concepts.longName: Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm in the Brain
Concepts.definition: A malignant neoplasm that has spread to the brain from another anatomic site or system. The majority are carcinomas (usually lung or breast carcinomas).
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient has known brain me
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has known brain metastases, have they have been treated and are stable in the view of the treating investigator?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has treated brain metastases, are they symptomatically stable while off steroid therapy for a minimum of 7 days?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has previously treated brain metastases, are they radiologically stable, i.e., without evidence of progression for at least 4 weeks by repeat imaging performed during screening (follow-up brain imaging after central nervous system (CNS)-directed therapy shows no evidence of progression), clinically stable and without requirement of steroid treatment for at least 14 days prior to first dose of study treatment?
